intro: Clerodendrum kissakense, commonly known as the African flame bush, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces small, dark blue or black berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Clerodendrum kissakense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
